org.eng.aisp.client.iotp

Class IOTPlatformProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.util.ComponentProperties
      • org.eng.aisp.client.iotp.IOTPlatformProperties

  • public class IOTPlatformProperties
extends ComponentProperties
    Defines a component properties search space with the name 'iotp'. The IoTP properties are used to define whether
    1. iotp is enabled at all, and if enabled
    2. 0 or more IOT application client connections (org id, application api key, auth token and enabled users)
    The instance can then be used to determine which IOT instance is assigned to a given user name as identified in the properties. Each instance defines the API-Key, Authentication-Token and enabled.users as follows: 
     <orgid>.API-Key=...
 <orgid>.Authentication-Token=...
 <orgid>.enabled.users=...
    Where the key, token and user correspond to an IOT instance with the orgid. An example properties file might look as follows: 
     iotp.enabled=true
 
 tkswpm.API-Key=a-tskwpm-3124435
 tkswpm.Authentication-Token=43mlkjfddasf
 tkswpm.enabled.users=userA@gmail.com,userB@ibm.com
 
 abcde.API-Key=a-abcde-90adf09
 abcde.Authentication-Token=234ka;le0a;
 abcde.enabled.users=userC@gmail.com,userD@ibm.com
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static IOTPlatformProperties instance()
        Get the global instance of PML properties.
        Returns:

      • getApplicationClient

        public IOTPApplicationClient getApplicationClient(String userName)
        Get a connected IOTPApplicationClient assigned to the given user name if this instance is enabled. Should be called between calls #connect() and #disconnect() otherwise null is always returned.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        Returns:
        null if not connected or the user is not assigned to an application client instance or if isEnabled() returns false.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()

      • connect

        public void connect(boolean verbose)
        Connect all application clients identified in the properties file.

      • getEnabledUsers

        public String[] getEnabledUsers(String orgID)
        Get the users enabled for a given IoT organization. By convention,
        • If null is returned, then notification is done for all users.
        • If an empty list is returned, then no users receive notification.
        Parameters:
        orgID -
        Returns:

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(boolean verbose)
        Disconnect all application clients connected during #connect().

      • getApplicationClientProperties

        public List<Properties> getApplicationClientProperties()
        Provided primarily for junit testing.
        Returns:

      • getApplicationClientProperties

        public Properties getApplicationClientProperties(String userName)
        Find the 1st IOT properties enabled for the given user, regardless of whether or not IOT is enabled. Organizations are search in lexigraphic order for the given user. If the user is not listed with any instance, then look for the 1st instance that allows all users.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        Returns:
        null if user is not enabled.
